patterns_discovered.description: Using MUI breakpoint system (xs, md) for responsive grid layouts
patterns_discovered.implementation: Conditional grid columns based on screen size - 2 columns on extra small screens, 4 columns on medium and above

patterns_discovered.description: Using skeleton loaders with responsive grid to match actual content layout during loading states
patterns_discovered.implementation: Grid container with repeated skeleton items

gotchas_discovered.description: Original 4-column grid layout was not responsive and would cause layout issues on mobile devices
gotchas_discovered.symptom: horizontal scrolling or cramped content on small screens

gotchas_discovered.description: When changing grid columns, skeleton item dimensions should remain consistent to avoid layout shift
gotchas_discovered.consideration: height property (100) is maintained to preserve skeleton aspect ratio

approach_outcome.implementation_strategy: Direct responsive grid enhancement using MUI sx prop breakpoints

recommendations.recommendation: Apply the same responsive grid pattern to all other skeleton loading grids in the application
recommendations.rationale: Ensures consistent responsive behavior across all loading states

recommendations.recommendation: Consider additional breakpoint for sm (small) screens if testing reveals 2 columns is still too crowded
recommendations.rationale: Fine-tuning breakpoints based on actual content and typography

recommendations.recommendation: Add responsive design tests covering xs and md breakpoints for skeleton loading states
recommendations.rationale: Prevent regression of mobile responsiveness in future updates

recommendations.recommendation: Consider extracting responsive grid breakpoint patterns into a shared constant or custom hook
recommendations.rationale: Reduces duplication if pattern is widely used throughout the application
